160.0: Yuan et al. [14] prepared HDPE coating through low temperature (5 °C) evaporation of a HDPE/xylene-ethanol solution in humid atmosphere (60–75% relative humidity), exhibiting a water contact angle (WCA) higher than 160 ± 2° and excellent stability under rigorous conditions.

160.5: It should be noted that commercial water based perfluoroacrylic copolymer from DuPont, Capstone ST-100, was employed as polymeric superhydrophobic coating which does not degrade into PFOAs [46] The 160.5 ± 3.5° and 4.7 ± 0.8° were obtained as an advancing contact angle and sliding angle, respectively.
